title: Constructivist-Based Language Concept Learning Instructional Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational educational theory and language teaching methodologies (grammatical systems, text analysis, communication strategies)
context.additional_context: For pre-service or in-service teachers, emphasizing competency in designing language education concept learning (grammar system construction, text-based activity design, learner expression assessment)

learning_goals: Cultivate the ability to design three types of language concept learning activities (vocabulary, grammar, text analysis) based on constructivist instructional methods.
Acquire the ability to create instructional design documents reflecting learners' language development stages, including grammar system charts and text difficulty analysis tables.

Learners analyze three recorded videos of corporate language training sessions and ten student response surveys within two weeks and write an evaluation report using a predefined 5-item effectiveness rubric (content delivery, grammatical clarity, vocabulary utilization, engagement, learning outcomes) rated on a 4-point scale (1-4) per item.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
